t: Some pages are meant to be read. Others are meant to be lived until the ink runs out.
Every book is a subway line. Some take you home. Some take you where you didn’t know you belonged.
A reading room isn’t quiet because no one’s talking. It’s quiet because every mind is somewhere else entirely.
In the margins, we write the parts of ourselves we don’t say out loud.
The city hums outside, but here—inside these walls—the only trains that matter run on paper.
Stories are just graffiti you can’t scrub off your soul.
